column2: $x_{1}$ is a history of $x_{2}$ according to $x_{3}$ (person)/from point-of-view $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a season/is seasonal [cyclical interval], defined by interval/property $x_{2}$, of year(s) $x_{3}$.
column3: Also anniversary (= {citsydei}, {na'arcitsydei}), jubilee (= {mumnoncitsi}); the period of time may be short or long as indicated by $x_2$, and may occur every year or every nth year as indicated by $x_3$ (default every year); ($x_2$ and/or $x_3$ may need metaphorical restriction: {djecitsi}, {pavdeicitsi}; also equinox, solstice, time of year.  See also {cedra}, {crisa}, {critu}, {dunra}, {ranji}, {temci}, {vensa}, {jbena}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a louse/flea [blood-sucking arthropod] of species/breed $x_{2}$, parasitic on $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is strange/weird/deviant/bizarre/odd to $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
column3: Also alien, mysterious, deviant, queer, unusual, exotic.  See also {ranxi}, {rirci}, {fange}, {banli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of rubber/latex from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of coffee from source/bean/grain $x_{2}$.
column3: Brew based on a seed/bean/grain; e.g. also chicory coffee, decaf, postum. See also {tcati}, brewed from a leaf, {barja}, {cakla}.

column2: $x_{1}$ has/is characterized by property/feature/trait/aspect/dimension $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{2}$ is manifest in $x_{1}$.
column3: Manifested/property/quality/trait/feature/aspect (= {selkai}).  See also: cmavo list {kai}, {ka}; {tcaci}, {tcini}. Need not be a defining property (which is what "characterize" means in English).

column2: $x_{1}$ is a bed/pallet of material $x_{2}$ for holding/supporting $x_{3}$ (person/object/event).
$x_{1}$ is perilous/dangerous/potentially harmful to $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ is a danger/peril to $x_2$.  See also te {bandu}, te {kajde}, te {marbi}, se {snura}, se {xalni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ ridicules/mocks/scoffs at $x_{2}$ about $x_{3}$ (property/event) by doing activity $x_{4}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ feels ashamed/mortified/humiliated under conditions $x_{2}$ before community/audience $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a key fitting/releasing/opening/unlocking lock $x_{2}$, and having relevant properties $x_{3}$.
column3: Also $x_2$ fastener, mechanism; code key (= {termifckiku}, {kiktermifra}); $x_3$ is dependent on the type of key, but are those form properties of the key that enable it to serve the function of opening the lock - in the case of a metal key to a padlock, for example, this would be the shaft and teeth.  See also {stela}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (si'o) is a scale of units for measuring/observing/determining $x_{2}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is related to/associated with/akin to $x_{2}$ by relationship $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is grateful/thankful to/appreciative of $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ (event/property).
$x_{1}$ is school/institute/academy at $x_{2}$ teaching subject(s) $x_{3}$ to audience/community $x_{4}$ operated by $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ is a conifer/pine/fir of species/strain $x_{2}$ with cones $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is loud/noisy at observation point $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is long in dimension/direction $x_{2}$ (default longest dimension) by measurement standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is without/lacking/free of/lacks $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$-less.
$x_{1}$ is a moss/lichen of species/strain $x_{2}$ growing on $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is mossy.
$x_{1}$ (event) is early by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is polite/courteous/civil in matter $x_{2}$ according to standard/custom $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ leaves/goes away/departs/parts/separates from $x_{2}$ via route $x_{3}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ leaves behind/takes leave of $x_2$.  See also {litru}, {canci}, {vimcu}, {lebna}, {muvdu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a loop/circuit of $x_{2}$ [material].
column3: Also noose (= {skoclupa}, {saljgeclupa}; there is no indication of shape, but merely that the ends join/meet); closed curve defined by set of points (= {cuptai}).  See also {djine}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mathematics of type/describing $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is small in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mountain/hill/mound/[rise]/[peak]/[summit]/[highlands] projecting from land mass $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a structure word of grammatical class $x_{2}$, with meaning/function $x_{3}$ in usage (language) $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_4$ may be a specific usage (with an embedded language place) or a massified language description; $x_3$ and $x_4$ may be merely an example of cmavo usage or refer to an actual expression; cmavo list, if physical object (= (loi) {ma'oste}); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new cmavo to the cmavo list = {ma'orpoi}, {ma'orselcmi}, {ma'orselste}).  See also {gismu}, {lujvo}, {gerna}, {smuni}, {valsi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of $x_{2}$ to/used-by namer/name-user $x_{3}$ (person).
column3: Also: $x_2$ is called $x_1$ by $x_3$ (= selcme for reordered places).  See also cmavo list {me'e}, {gismu}, {tcita}, {valsi}, {judri}. Historically used to describe words in the Lojban morphological class allocated for use with proper nouns; this sense has been deprecated in favor of {cmevla}.

column2: $x_{1}$ laughs (emotional expression).
$x_{1}$ is a member/element of set $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ belongs to group $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is amid/among/amongst group $x_{2}$.
column3: $x_1$ may be a complete or incomplete list of members; $x_2$ is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership.  See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, cmavo list {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.

column2: $x_{1}$ utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] $x_{2}$ expressing $x_{3}$ (property).
column3: Also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow. See also {krixa}, {bacru}, {cusku}, {cortu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ [value] is a norm/average in property/amount $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) among $x_{3}$(s) (set) by standard $x_{4}$.
column3: Also mean, normal, usual; ($x_3$ specifies the complete set).  See also {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the neck [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: a relatively narrow point].
$x_{1}$ (agent) rewards $x_{2}$ [recipient] for atypical $x_{3}$ (event/property) with reward/desserts $x_{4}$.
column3: Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= {zanyne'u}), punishment, penalty, demerit (= {malne'u}, {sfane'u}); $x_4$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posne'u}, {posyvelne'u} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is orderly/neat/ordered in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni).
$x_{1}$ is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer $x_{2}$ in feature $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is a novelty.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead (Pb); [metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal].
$x_{1}$ is directly/vertically beneath/below/under/underneath/down from $x_{2}$ in frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ broadcasts/transmits [using radio waves] $x_{2}$ via station/frequency $x_{3}$ to [radio] receiver $x_{4}$.
column3: Also $x_1$ is a broadcaster.  See also {tivni}, {benji}, {tcana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is anterior/ahead/forward/(in/on) the front of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
column3: Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$. See also {sefta}, {flira}, {trixe}, {mlana}, {pritu}, {zunle}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a shirt/blouse/top [upper-body garment - not necessarily sleeved or buttoned], material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) harvests/reaps/gathers crop/product/objects $x_{2}$ from source/area $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bear/ursoid of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fairy/elf/gnome/brownie/pixie/goblin/kobold [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $x_{2}$.
column3: Also orc, giant, demon or devil (when humanoid-form is presumed by the mythos/religion), bugbear, bogeyman.  (cf. {ranmi}, especially for non-humanoid creatures of myth, {lijda})

column2: $x_{1}$ is green/verdant [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a bridge/span over/across $x_{2}$ between $x_{3}$ and $x_{4}$ [unordered, typically destination first].
$x_{1}$ is summer/summertime [hot season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is autumn/fall [harvest/cooling season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tide [cyclical/periodic expansion] in $x_{2}$ caused by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the lip [body-part]/rim of orifice $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is labial.
$x_{1}$ is a tax/levy/duty on goods/services/event $x_{2}$ levied against $x_{3}$ by authority/collector $x_{4}$.
column3: Also custom, toll, tariff, tribute. See also {pleji}, {flalu}, {turni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of petroleum/oil from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shadow/the shade of object $x_{2}$, made by light/energy source $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ teaches audience $x_{2}$ ideas/methods/lore $x_{3}$ (du'u) about subject(s) $x_{4}$ by method $x_{5}$ (event).
column3: Also instruct, instructor, educate, educator, teacher, professor, pedagogue; (adjective:) $x_1$/$x_5$ is pedagogical.  See also {ckule}, {cilre}, {tadni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is round/circular [2-dimensional shape/form]; $x_{1}$ is a disk/circle/ring.
column3: Normally used for a filled-in circle/disk, but emphasis on roundness means that the concept may include 'ring'.  See also {djine}, {ranji}, {bolci}, {tarmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a book containing work $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$ preserved in medium $x_{5}$.
column3: $x_1$ is a copy/manifestation/container (a physical object or its analogue) of a literary work [$x_2$], not necessarily using paper (= {selpapri}). See also {cfika}, {prina}, {prosa}, {tcidu}, {papri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is full/completely filled with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state/property) is possible under conditions $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ may/might occur; $x_{1}$ is a maybe.
$x_{1}$ is humble/modest about $x_{2}$ (abstraction); $x_{1}$ displays humility about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of millet [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is random/fortuitous/unpredictable under conditions $x_{2}$, with probability distribution $x_{3}$.
column3: Also accidental, chancy, by chance, adventitious, arbitrary (also = {cuncu'a}, {cunselcu'a}, {cunjdi}, {cunseljdi}; based on "unpredictable").  See also {cnici}, {lakne}, {funca}, {kalsa}, {snuti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is an affair/organized activity involving person(s) $x_{2}$ (ind./mass); $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s business.
column3: Also matter, concern; $x_2$ is engaged in $x_1$ (which is usually an abstraction) (= {selcu'u} for reordered places). See also {jikca}, {srana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ produces $x_{2}$ [product] by process $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) lets/permits/allows $x_{2}$ (event) under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ grants privilege $x_{2}$.
column3: Sufficient condition (= {crutcini}), agent that permits a situation (= {tcinycru}).  See also {rinju}, {banzu}, {ralte}, {jimte}, {jaspu}, {zifre}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a worm/invertebrate animal of species/breed $x_{2}$.
column3: Also mollusk, snail (= {cakcurnu}), shellfish (= {xaskemcakcurnu}, {xaskemcakydja}); the generalization to invertebrate is because many multicellular invertebrates are indeed wormlike.  See also {since}, {silka}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is pure/unadulterated/unmitigated/simple in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ (agent) expresses/says $x_{2}$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $x_{3}$ via expressive medium $x_{4}$.
column3: Also says.  See also {bacru}, {tavla}, {casnu}, {spuda}, cmavo list {cu'u}, {bangu}, {dapma}, {jufra}, {pinka}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a shoe/boot/sandal for covering/protecting [feet/hooves] $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the chest/thorax/upper trunk/[rib cage/breast] [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ chooses/selects $x_{2}$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $x_{3}$ (complete set).
$x_{1}$ is a drawer/file in structure $x_{2}$, a [sliding compartment] container for contents $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a material object enduring in space-time; $x_{1}$ is a thing.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the Taoist culture/ethos/religion in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the tooth [body-part] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is dental.
$x_{1}$ is dense/concentrated/packed/intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) at location/locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ awaits/waits/pauses for/until $x_{2}$ at state $x_{3}$ before starting/continuing $x_{4}$ (activity/process).
column3: ($x_2$ is an event, usually a point event); also: resuming $x_4$.  See also {dicra}, {fanmo}, {sisti}, {fliba}, {pandi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of dirt/soil/earth/ground from source $x_{2}$ of composition $x_{3}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ is earthen; $x_3$: composition including $x_3$, which need not be exhaustive of composition.  See also {kliti}, {terdi}, {loldi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a heap/pile/stack/mound/hill of materials $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ shakes/quakes/trembles/quivers/shudders/wobbles/vibrates from force $x_{2}$.
column3: Also (expressible either with desku or slilu): side to side, to and fro, back and forth, reciprocal motion.  See also {slilu}, {janbe}.

column2: $x_1$ is the date [day,{week},{month},year] of event/state $x_2$, at location $x_3$, by calendar $x_4$.
column3: Time units in x1 are specified as numbers separated by pi'e, starting from the smallest time unit, or are unit values massified with joi. Alternatively, the time units in x1 are specified as numbers prefixed by {ny} for years, {ly} for months, {dy} for days, {cy} for hours, {my} for minutes, and {sy} for seconds, and in this scheme, any time unit may be left out. Cf. {de'i}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {masti}, {nanca}, {tcika}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) interrupts/stops/halts/[disrupts] $x_{2}$ (object/event/process) due to quality $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is electricity [electric charge or current] in/on $x_{2}$ of polarity/quantity $x_{3}$ (def. negative).
column3: ($x_3$, a quantifier, can be expressed as a simple polarity using the numerals for positive and negative ma'u and ni'u); (explicitly) negative (= {dutydikca}), positive (= {mardikca}); current (= {selmuvdikca}, {muvdikca}; again default negative/electron current), charge (= {klodikca}, {stadikca}).  See also {lindi}, {xampo}, {flecu}, {maksi}, {tcana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is local to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is confined to locus $x_{2}$ within range $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is regional
column3: Indicates a specific location/value within a range; e.g. a hits b.  What is the locality on b that a hits?  Thus $x_1$ is associated with a specific narrow region/interval $x_2$ of wider space/range $x_3$.  See also cmavo list {di'o}, {jibni}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {nenri}, {lamji}, {stuzi}, {tcila}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is regular/cyclical/periodic in property (ka)/activity $x_{2}$ with period/interval $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quotient of '$x_{2}$/$x_{3}$' [dividend $x_{2}$ divided by divisor $x_{3}$], leaving remainder $x_{4}$.
{ckilu} modal, 1st place                            on the scale ...
tanru inversion operator; "... of type ..."; allows modifier trailing sumti without sumti links.
interval event contour: at the starting point of ...; initiative                   >|<    |.
elliptical/unspecified bridi relationship.
interval event contour: at the instantaneous point of ...; achievative/perfective; point event   >|<.
vocative: greetings/hello.
elidable marker: separates selbri from preceding sumti, allows preceding terminator elision.
unary mathematical operator: absolute value/norm  |a|.
tense/modal question.
attitudinal: neutral scalar attitude modifier.
convert number to probability selbri; event $x_{1}$ has probability (n) of occurring under cond. $x_{2}$.
{cusku} modal, 1st place (attribution/quotation)    as said by source ...; used for quotation.
letteral for c.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 1 (usually restricted).
digit/number: all except n; all but n; default 1.
binary mathematical operator: logarithm; [log/ln a to base b]; default base 10 or e.
pro-sumti: a recent utterance.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 3 (usually restricted).
event contour for resumption of a paused process.
pro-sumti: the next utterance.
tense interval modifier: regularly; subjective tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
$x_1$ is of size/measurement $x_2$ in dimension/aspect $x_3$
$x_1$ is a regular polyhedra/polygon/polytope with the Schläfli symbol {$x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$, …}
column3: also "$x_1$ is a regular polytope". Polytope is a collective term for polygons, polyhedra and other dimentional shapes. "$x_1$ is a regular polytope with the Schläfli symbol $x_2$" is also valid if you want to use vectors. For Coxeter's extention, use a matrix. Cf. {kubli}

column2: $x_1$ is an axis/center curve/extended center (or, possibly metaphorically, focus 'point') of $x_2$ in sense $x_3$
column3: For figures of revolution, $x_3$ = "lo ka ce'u srana lo {jbislanu}". For rotation (in which mass is actually moving around it), $x_3$ = "lo ka ce'u se carna". For a political axis, $x_3$ would be filled with a reference to political importance or alliance. This word should probably not be used for coordinate systems (coordinate axes), but some construct involving {manri} might be apt for such an idea if used. The axis is the center of all considerations being made and is extended.

column2: $x_1$ is a mathematical set, containing members $x_2$

$x_1$ is meta to/an example of $x_2$ that describes such an object/concept/notion/system/topic/etc., being meta in property/aspect $x_3$, and which has features $x_4$, governed by/considered in system/considerations/epistemology/theory $x_5$; $x_1$ is meta (a particular type of abstraction of $x_2$ so as to apply to itself in some sense); $x_1$ is an/a piece of/an example of $x_2$ that applies fractally thereto
column3: Does not (necessarily) mean "beyond", "after", "beside"; in some (rather pictoral) senses, these meanings may be necessary but not sufficient for being meta in this sense; thus, "metaphysics" should not be translated using this word. x1 is an object, notion, topic, system, etc. which applies to x2 but which is itself an example thereof; for example, the meanings of the words "metalinguistics" and "metadata" are meta in this sense. It is not necessarily directly self-referential, but could be fractally applicative. x1 is an X that is about (another) X; x1 is an abstraction of X so as to apply to X. x1 does not necessarily abstract [from] (in one sense), but is abstract to, x2. See also: {xulta} (generalized/weaker), {sucta}.

column2: $x_1$ is a morphologically defined name word meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
column3: (By analogy with {brivo}; syn. {cmevla}) In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. In Lojban, a {cmevo} may only consist of a single word, whereas a {cmene} can consist of one or multiple words, which may be cmevo. See also {vlaturge'a}.

column2: $x_1$ empathizes with $x_2$, showing same emotion $x_3$ about $x_4$
column3: A gismu for a very important concept that, for some reason, didn't find its way into the gimste. See {cinmo}, {dai}, {dunli}.

column2: $x_1$ is a mythological/fantastic creature [mythical organism] of mythos/religion/story/culture $x_2$.
column3: Need not be an animal, nor even active, but must be alive/active/animate (includes ghosts, spirits, genies, golems, etc.). The reference set of this word is a strict superset of the reference set of "{crida}".  See also: "{ranmi}".
column5: mythological animal;mythological automaton;mythological fungus;mythological organism;mythological plant

column2: $x_1$ reflects/relates to/pertains to CLL (Lojbanic) grammatical standards in manner/aspect $x_2$, specific to version $x_3$ (contextless default: the most recent version that has been officially accepted by the Lojban language's governing body (presently, the BPFK))
$x_1$ is an arthropod; $x_1$ is a bug (broad sense)
column3: For a world in which {cinki} means "insect" or "hexapod". The source words for {cinki} mean "insect", so I prefer narrowing its meaning and adding a new word for "arthropod" based on more fitting source words. See also {lokra}, {jukni}, {sortu'e}

column2: $x_1$ (scalar-valued) is the norm/magnitude/size of concrete (and specific) mathematical object $x_2$ in norm space/according to metric (if relevant)/by definition/of type $x_3$
$x_1$ deduces/reasons by deduction/establishes by deduction that $x_2$ is true about $x_3$ from general rule $x_4$

$x_1$ is aligned diagonally along/between nonadjacent vertices $x_2$ as in polytope $x_3$; $x_1$ is a diagonal line segment/linear manifold of lower dimension as viewed in frame of reference $x_3$; $x_1$ is crooked (one sense), skew (one sense, see notes), off-kilter (one sense), away from center/off-center, non-orthogonal/not perpendicular nor parallel, at an angle, perhaps non-vertical and non-horizontal, diagonal to $x_2$ in figure/coordinate system $x_3$.
column3: Not for use in: entries of tensors/matrices (confer: {daigno}), certain geometric meanings (such as with Cartesian products), etc.  Only for purely 'visual' geometric objects/figures/frames. The polytope in question need not actually be 'drawn'; an oriented frame of reference naturally 'projects' a polytopic sense onto all objects. x1 can be any linear manifold of lower dimension than the space in which it is embedded (defined by x3). The skewness is not relative to another linear manifold in some higher-dimensional space (the usual definition of "skew" in geometry) - it is simply a skewness (in a layperson sense) relative to points in a figure or axis in a coordinate system. Proposed by Gleki.

column2: $x_1$=$l_1$ is calligraphy
$c_1$=$f_1$ smiles at $f_3$ under conditions $f_4$.
$x_1$ is a smile (facial expression)
$t_1$ (hours, minutes, seconds) is the daylight saving time of state/event $t_2$ on day $t_3$ at location $t_4$=$c_3$.
$b_1$=$f_1$=$c_1$ is a heifer [young female bovine/cow] of species/breed $b_2$=$f_2$ by standard $f_3$=$c_2$.
$k_1$ is a kid of goat species $k_2$.
$x_1$ eats another which eats another which ... which eats another which eats $x_2$ via intermediate steps $x_3$ (ce'o).
$z_1$=$c_1$ is younger than $z_2$ by amount $z_4$.
$m_1$=$c_1$ is a younger sister of $m_2$
$m_1$ is a young cat/kitten [feline animal] of species/breed $m_2$; (adjective:) $m_1$ is a young feline.
$m_1$ is cute to $m_2$ in aspect $m_3$.
$n_1$=$c_1$ is a youth/young man by standard $c_2$.
$p_1$ has a crush on/is infatuated with $p_2$
$t_1$=$c_1$ is youngest among $t_4$.
$x_1$  is a scallion/green onions/spring onions/salad onions/green shallots/onions having hollow green leaves and lacking a fully developed root bulb (genus Allium) of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a monsoon
$x_1$ migrates to $x_2$ from $x_3$ over path/route $x_4$ in season $x_5$.
$r_1$ is a quantity of/contains veal/bovine meat/flesh from young bovine/cattle $c_2$=$b_1$=$c_1$.
$g_1$ is a young dog/canine/[bitch]/puppy of species/breed $g_2$.

column2: $co_1$ is a/the anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic end (anatomy)/superior end (human anatomy) of body/object $cl_1$; $co_1$ (subevent) is at the starting point of long event/time-intervall $cl_1$.
column3: Metaphor: A tree grows in its long direction, with the roots as its starting point ({co'a}) and the crown as its ending point ({co'u}). Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity. In vertebrate usually the head, in invertebrate the end with a mouth (or equivalent structure), or the end that usually points in the direction of the organism's locomotion. See also anterior/superior absolute position ({claco'uklo}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'u}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}).

column2: $co_1$ is a/the anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic end (anatomy)/superior end (human anatomy)/fore/bow (nautical)/nose (skateboard etc), of body/object $cl_1$; $co_1$ (subevent) is at the ending point of long event/time-intervall $cl_1$.
column3: Metaphor: A tree grows in its long direction, with the roots as its starting point ({co'a}) and the crown as its ending point ({co'u}). Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity, but not restricted to anatomical objects. In vertebrate usually the head, in invertebrate the end with a mouth (or equivalent structure), or the end that usually points in the direction of the organism's locomotion. In most animals the same as the front (={craraipau}), but in humans the same as the top (={gapraipau}). See also anterior/superior absolute position ({claco'uklo}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'a}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}/{bekpyco'u}).

column2: $co_1$=$d_1$ is/are anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic (anatomy)/superior  (human anatomy) with frame-of-reference body/object $cl_1$=$d_3$.
column3: Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity, but not restricted to anatomical objects. In most animals the same as the front (={craraipau}), but in humans the same as the top (={gapraipau}). See also anterior/superior end ({claco'u}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'a}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}/{bekpyco'u}).

column2: $co_1$=$z_1$ is/are anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic (anatomy)/superior (human anatomy) to $z_2$ by margin $z_4$, in body/object $cl_1$=$d_3$.
column3: Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity, but not restricted to anatomical objects. In most animals the same as 'in front of' (={crane}), but in humans the same as 'above' (={gapru}). See also anterior/superior absolute position ({claco'uklo}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'a}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}/{bekpyco'u}).

column2: $x_1$ is a long knife
column3: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

column2: $xa_1$=$d_1$=$c_1$ is a sword / long knife weapon for use against $xa_2$=$d_2$ by $xa_3$ with blade of material $d_3$ long by standard $c_3$.

$t_1$ is a grape tomato of variety/strain $t_2$.
$x_1$ (object/dimension) is shortest among set $x_2$ (set) in respective dimensions $x_3$ (default: the longest for each).
column3: Equivalent to "{toryrai}". Partially an .{u'ivla}, but with a little bit of philosophical underpinning: We should measure things by how much they have rather than how much they lack (good: how bright, how strong, how rich; bad: how dark, how weak, how poor) because 0 is the natural starting point and the quantity usually can be increased without upper bound. So, longness is a thing and shortness is a figment of our collective imagination, so to speak. So, "shortest" should really be "least long". Meanwhile, "{traji}" can accept either valence for extremeness, but defaults to the positive (id est: "most"), so we need to cajole it into the opposite ("least"). Thus, we get this long, gross word.

column3: This word is itself a cmapagjvo. In intermediate stages of reducing/analyzing the veljvo $x_4$, some constituents themselves may be cmapagjvo; however, after a total reduction, all parts must be or represent cmavo and gismu, only. Contrast with "{brapagjvo}".

column3: Location or orbital/trajectory characteristic does not matter so long as the object is distinct and enduring; this is an intrinsic property; thus, a bolide during or even after impact or entry may still be considered a cmaplini. Cf.: {solri}, {terdi}, {lunra}, {mluni}, {bisycmaplini}, {rokcmaplini}, {plinycma}, {jdikyplini}.

column2: $x_1$ is an asteroid belt, generalized Kuiper belt, or other such belt in stellar/star or planet-centered/planetary ring system $x_2$, extending over and throughout region $x_3$, including/containing objects or points of interest $x_4$, with other properties/orbital parameters $x_5$.
column3: This word is a {brapagjvo} involving "{jinrcaibyca'u}". Technically, this word should only be used when the region may be described as an example of a jinrcaibyca'u; thus, this word does not apply to and cannot be used in order to describe 'clouds' of celestial objects (such as the Oort Cloud) or more complicated regions of space which may exist in star systems with multiple major massive objects (such as binary star systems). It can, however, be used for planetary rings. See also: "{belta}", "{cmaplini}".

column2: $d_1$=$c_1$ is a chisel for carving $d_2$=$c_2$ with blade of material $d_3$.

$x_1$ (li) is the (signed) difference between the average of all elements/data of $x_2$ (completely specified ordered multiset/list) and single number $x_3$ (li; default: infimum of $x_2$ under ordering $x_6$ if such is finite), using averaging function $x_4$ (default: arithmetic average), weights $x_5$ (completely specified ordered multiset/list with the same cardinality/length as $x_2$; default: according to notes), and inherited ordering $x_6$ (default: standard ordering on the set of reals).
column3: Default for $x_5$ is the same as the default for the weights of the given averaging function $x_4$, which for the arithmetic mean of a finite set is the ordered set of $|x_2|$ terms with each term equal identically to $1/|x_2|$, where "| |" represents the cardinality of its input (circumfixed). $x_6$ is defined on a superset of $x_2$ united with the singleton of $x_3$. The default for $x_6$ is {mrenspoi}. For example: If $x_2 = (1, 7)$ and all of the defaults hold, then $x_1 = avg(1,7) - min(1,7) = 4 - 1 = 3$; when all defaults hold and $x_2$ is a bounded set, $x_1$ is the difference between the arithmetic average of (or average of the uniform distribution on) $x_2$ and the infimum of $x_2$. See also: "{sigma}".

column2: $x_1$ makes $x_2$ vary in property $x_3$ in amount $x_4$ under conditions $x_5$

$v_1$ is an interjection/attitudinal meaning $v_2$=$c_1$ in language $v_3$.
$x_1$=$m_1$ is a therapist treating $x_2$=$m_2$=$c_1$ for $x_3$=$m_3$=$c_2$ with treatment $x_4$=$m_4$.
$x_1$=$m_1$=$c_3$ is romantic to $x_2$=$m_2$; $x_1$ is beautiful to $x_2$ because it follows or is based on some emotional ideal that may not actually reflect reality.
column3: Not "romantic" in the sense of "pertaining to intimate love" (={cinpamra'a}); rather, "romantic" in the sense of viewing emotions as a higher and more important quality with extraordinary properties. See also {cinmo}, {melbi}.

column2: $x_1$ (event/state) feels (emotionally) good / pleasant / nice to $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$
$r_1$ is the sense/feeling in $c_1$ of emotion $c_2$ about $c_3$.
$x_1$=$p_1$ is a question about $x_3$=$c_2$=$p_4$’s emotion, asked by $x_2$=$p_3$ to $x_3$=$c_3$=$p_4$.
$x_1$=$r_1$ (event) moves/touches $x_2$=$c_1$ (person), causing emotion $x_3$=$c_2$ about object of emotion $x_4$=$c_3$ with causation conditions $x_5$=$r_3$; $x_1$=$r_1$ (event) is moving/touching.
$s_1$ is the heart (emotional self) of $s_2$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ emotionally disbelieves $x_2$ (du'u) about subject $x_3$
column3: May or may not contrast with one's more-conscious or rational beliefs; related to the concept of "alief" ({kricili}). See {cinmo}, {senpi}, {cnikri}

column2: $x_1$=$ci_1$=$cu_1$ expresses emotion $x_2$=$ci_2$=$cu_2$/emotionally expresses $x_2$ for audience $x_3$=$cu_3$ via expressive medium $x_4$=$cu_4$.
$t_1$=$c_2$ is the mood experienced by $t_2$=$c_1$ about $c_3$.
$v_1$ sighs due to emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ breathing/respiring $v_2$.
$x_1$ is therapy, given to patient $x_2$ for ailment $x_3$ by therapist $x_4$
$xr_1$ offends $xr_2$=$c_1$ affecting emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ resulting in $xr_4$ (state).
$c_1$=$n_1$ is deep inside $n_2$ by standard $c_4$
column3: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {condi},{nenri}

column2: $x_1$=$p_1$ is the t(h)alweg (path following the deepest points along the course) in/of/belonging to geographical/hydrological/potential feature $x_2$=$c_1$=$t_1$ from $x_3$=$p_2$ to $x_4$=$p_3$
column3: Potential in the definition refers to the scalar field, a sense used in physics.

column2: $x_1$=$cf_1$ [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur from its natural start; (intransitive verb).
column3: See {co'a} {cfari}. $x_1$ starts from the very beginning. Also in the sense of 'starting anew' or 'starting from scratch'.

column2: $b_1$ starts to become $b_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$c_1$ (agent) starts to express/say $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$.
$x_1$ kneels/genuflects with meaning $x_2$ on surface $x_3$ on/with limb(s) $x_4$ of body $x_5$.
column3: Usually implies obeisance, homage, devotion, loyalty, obedience, subservience, vulnerability, or some other form of inferiority or trust. Specify the recipient of said inferiority or trust expression via/in $x_2$. Mere "{cidytse}" is an action which may not convey any semantic information. This word uses experimental rafsi "-coc-", which has been proposed to be assigned to experimental gismu "{corci}". This word is, for now, equivalent to "{cidytsecorci}", mostly because .krtisfranks. cannot semantically distinguish between "a kneeling-type-of semantic-gesture" and "a semantic-gesture-type-of kneeling".

column2: $k_1$ plays charades/gesture-game $ci_1$=$k_2$ governed by rules $ci_2$ interrelating game parts (physical or conceptual; includes gestures) $ci_3$
column3: From {corci} {ciste} {kelci}. corci1 is included in ciste3. See also {cockei}

column2: $s_1$=$c_1$ is a deep/rumbling sound produced by $s_2$=$c_2$ from point of reference $c_3$.
column3: $c_3$ could also be interpreted as a particular pitch/frequency. See also: {condi}, {sance}.

column2: $x_1$ is a rowing boat or sculler, carrying $x_2$, pulled by $x_3$.
$x_1$ rows or sculls on route $x_2$ with boat, rowing boat or scull $x_3$.
$l_1$=$m_1$ is a tractor pulling $l_2$.
$g_1$=$l_1$ pulls $m_1$=$l_2$ to destination $m_2$ from origin $m_3$ over path/route $m_4$ at handle/locus $l_3$.
$p_1$ is a harpsichord.
$c_1$ is a radio transceiver transmitting/receiving $c_2$ on frequency $c_3$ to/from transceiver $c_4$.
column3: The $x_3$ place may specify more than one frequency, for instance in cases where different frequencies are used for transmission and receipt. Cf. {veltivni}.

column2: $s_1$ is a front vowel sound.
$ci_1$=$cr_1$ is a heads-up display (HUD) for user $s_1$ of machine/system $s_2$ based on principle $ci_3$. It is shown/visible in front of $cr_2$, as seen from the user's viewpoint.
column3: A very general sense of “heads-up display” is used here; it is not limited to one single application. For example, it could be used to refer to both the heads-up display of modern aircraft as well as the heads-up display in computing and video games. Cf. {crane}, {sazycimde}.

column2: $k_1$=$c_1$ advances to $k_2$ from $k_3$=$c_2$ via $k_4$ using means/vehicle $k_5$.
$k_1$ is an anteroom of/in structure $k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$l_1$ is an initial letter in alphabet/character-set $l_2$ representing $l_3$.
$t_1$=$c_1$ is/are the frontmost among set/range $t_4$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $c_3$.
column3: Be careful not to use this when {li'enrai} is meant.  Their meanings may overlap somewhat.

column2: $x_1$ is a president; $x_1$ is president of $x_2$
column3: Wide sense; like {jatna}, plus the "president" title. See also {ianlaua}, {gugja'a}, {kagja'a}, {presidente}

column2: $v_1$=$c_1$ is a front door/gateway/access between $v_2$ and $v_3$ of structure $v_4$.

column5: front cover illustration;front cover image;front cover picture

column2: $c_1$=$b_1$ becomes expert at $c_2$=$b_2$ under conditions $b_3$ by standard $c_3$.
column3: Coined because {cilre} makes it hard to talk about just learning about a subject. Cf. {ckule}, {saske}, {ctuca}.

column2: $x_1$ (event) is a test/examination of $x_2$'s skill/competence in subject $x_3$
$j_1$=$c_2$ is a profession (job) of person $j_2$=$c_1$.
column3: Especially a job requiring a high level of skill or training. Cf. {jibri}, {gunka}, {certu}.

column2: $cu_1$ is a barista/is skilled at making coffee drink/product $cu_2$=$ck_1$ by process $cu_3$.
column3: See also espresso (={kafrspreso}), coffeehouse/coffee bar (={kafybarja}), espresso machine (={cabrspreso}).

column2: $x_1$ does $x_2$ in a skilled manner

$x_1$=$ce_1$=$cu_1$ expertly produces artwork $x_2$=$cu_2$ of craft/skill $x_3$=$ce_2$=$l_2$ by process $x_4$=$cu_3$ expertly produced by standard $x_5$=$ce_3$.
$x_1$ suggests/offers expert advice/protip $x_2$ (ka) to $x_3$.
$j_1$=$c_1$ skillfully handles $j_2$=$c_2$ in event $j_3$.
$c_1$=$xa_1$ is a geek/nerd of field $c_2$=$xa_2$ (event/activity) by standard $c_3$.
$x_1$ practices/exercises/drills/trains in/for action/event/performance $x_2$.
$x_1$ is bearberry of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1$ (mass of facts) is the science of fairies/elves/pixies [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $c_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
column5: science of elves;science of fairies;science of gnomes;science of goblins;science of mythical humanoids;science of pixies;science of sprites

column2: $x_1$=$g_1$ causes $x_2$=$c_1$ to lose property $x_3$=$c_2$
column3: The third place of cirko is the event itself. cf. {cirko} and {gasnu}

column2: $x_0$: No pain, no gain. You have to work for what you want. (nullary predicate)

$g_1$ (agent) hurts/causes pain for $c_1$ at locus $c_2$.
$g_1$ practices sadomasochism with $g_2$=$c_1$ with pain at locus $c_2$.
$r_1$ (event/state) hurts/causes pain for $x_2$=$c_1$ at locus $x_3$=$c_2$.

$v_1$ is a hot/spicy taste/flavor of/emitted by $v_2$.
$x_1$=$j_1$=$c_1$ is a rule permitting/allowing $x_2$=$j_2$=$c_2$ (event/state) within system/community $x_3$=$j_3$ under conditions $x_4$=$c_3$
column3: The use of $c_1$ there is perhaps a bit iffy; the point here is that it's non-agentive.

column2: $t_1$ is a situation / condition / state / position that allows / is sufficient for event $c_2$=$t_2$ under conditions $c_3$.
column3: As the whole point of this word is to ignore the agentive nature of c1, c1 has been dropped.  Cf. {curmi}, {tcini}, {rau}, {banzu}.

column2: $v_1$ is a permit allowing $c_2$ (event) under conditions $c_3$, preserved in medium $v_4$.
$x_1$ is a type theory.
$k_1$=$c_1$ is the audit committee of $k_3$.
$x_1$ is a nightjar/goatsucker/whippoorwill of genus/species $x_2$.

$d_1$ is dew.

$m_1$ is the midnight of $n_2$ at location $n_3$.

$f_1 = r_1 = x_1$ (event; perhaps: spacetime coordinates) is an equinox for season $x_2$ at location/of or for celestial body/object $d_3 = x_3$ with respect to orbit/sun $x_4$.
column3: This word is perfectly and exactly semantically equivalent to "{dornilteikeznulfau}", except at most in terms of emphasis and connotation and poetic value. Unlike the pair "{ctenilteikezraifau}" and "{dornilteikezraifau}", neither of the "equinox" words herein referenced thus far have a default or preference for any given season.

column2: $f_1 = r_1 = x_1$ (event; perhaps: spacetime coordinates) is a solstice of extreme $r_3 = x_2$ ("ka" construct or season; default: "ka zmadu", which means "Winter solstice", unless context makes this interpretation untenable) at location/of or for celestial body/object $d_3 = x_3$ with respect to orbit/sun $x_4$.
column3: This word is exactly analogous to "{dornilteikezraifau}" and (conceptually speaking) does nothing other than merely multiplying dornilteikezraifau$_2$ by $-1$. All of the notes and commentary for that word apply here. See also: "{ctenilteikeznulfau}".

column2: $x_1$ is a nightingale of species/variety $x_2$.

column3: cf. {ctidakfu}, {ctitci}. Note that {forca} is specific enough in most contexts, even more so than {dakfu}, due to not being confusable with t.ex. {tamcydakfu}.

column2: $g_1$ feeds $c_1$ with food $c_2$.
$x1$=$k1$ is a bowl for food $x2$=$c2$=$k2$ made from material $x3$=$k3$

$x_1$ is a squirrel.

column2: $p_1$ sets up diet $p_2$ for $c_1$ consisting of food $c_2$.

$x_1$ is edible to $x_2$
$d1$ is $d2$ full hectodays (hundred day unit) in duration (default is 1 hectoday) by standard $d3$

column2: $x_1$ is a charizard [pokemon]
$x_1$ is $x_2$ centuries in duration by standard $x_3$.

$cu_1$=$ct_1$ is a textbook for teaching ideas/methods $ct_3$ (du'u), by author $cu_3$ for audience $cu_4$=$ct_2$ about subject(s) $ct_4$ by method $ct_5$, preserved in medium $cu_5$.

$n_1$ are instructions by $c_1$ teaching audience $c_2$ ideas/methods/lore $c_3$ (du'u) about subject(s) $c_4$ by method $c_5$ (event).
$x_1$=$n_1$=$c_5$ is a lecture / an event of verbal teaching by $x_2$=$t_1$=$c_1$ to audience $x_3$=$t_2$=$c_2$ about subject $x_4$=$t_3$=$c_4$ in language $x_5$=$t_4$ with facts taught $x_6$=$c_3$.
$x_1$ is a class (instructional session) on topic $x_2$ taught by $x_3$ to audience $x_4$
column3: Refers to a single event, e.g. "I have a class at 3:30." For a  course of instruction, see {ctusfimei}.

column2: $x_1$ is a course (series of lessons) on subject $x_2$, taught by $x_3$ to audience $x_4$
column3: Refers to a full course of instruction, i.e. a curriculum or series of individual lessons at an educational institution. For an individual lesson, see {ctusfi}.

column2: $cm_1$=$cu_1$ is a member of electorate $cm_2$, which votes/selects $cu_2$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $cu_3$.
column3: Gismu deep structure is "cuxna gi'e cmima"; Cf. {turni}, {cmicu'a}, {gubycu'a}, {jecta}.

column2: $k_1$=$c_1$ is a gaming die, with sides $k_3$=$c_3$, with side $c_2$ facing up and having dimensions $k_2$.
$m_1$ is a skate carrying $m_2$ on surface/medium $m_3$.
$t_1$ is the heel of shoe $t_2$=$c_1$ for covering/protecting feet $c_2$, and of material $c_3$.
$cl_1$ is barefoot/not wearing shoes.
$x_1$=$d_1$ is the toe of shoe $x_2$=$d_2$=$c_1$.
$x_1$=$k_5$ is a roller skate to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$, transporting $x_5$=$k_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a pie-chart of/about $x_{2}$ showing formation/data-points $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ orbits something which orbits ... which orbits something which orbits $x_2$ via intermediate steps $x_3$ (ce'o).
column3: Could also apply to gravitationally bound bodies, regardless of the paths which they take.

column2: $l_1$ goes/moves around/[in a circle] using means $l_3$.
$v_4$=$m_1$=$c_1$ is a computer disk/hard disk/floppy disk storing $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event) in file(s) $v_1$.
$v_4$=$m_1$=$c_1$ is a compact disc/optical disc storing $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event) in file(s) $v_1$.
$m_1$=$c_1$ (object) is completely round/full.
$x_1$ is the mathematical constant π (the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter)
$x_1$ is a disc (shape).
$j_1$ plays ultimate frisbee against $j_2$ in competition $j_3$ for prize/title $j_4$.
$t_1$=$c_1$ is an circle-shaped / circular object.
column3: $x_1$ is for objects resembling circles, rather than the abstract concept of circles themselves ({cuktai}). See also {tarmi}, {cukla}.

column2: $t_1$=$c_1$ is a circle.
$j1$ is a cirque/corrie/cwm between mountains/hills $c1$=$j2$ in terrain $c2$
$m_3$=$c_1$ is a disc [circular physical object] made of a material $m_1$.
$x1$=$k3$ is a roundabout of road $x2$=$d1$
$x_1$ is a ring/torus/oval [round, closed shape/form], composed of material $x_2$, of inner diameter $x_3$ and outer diameter of $x_4$
column3: This word is essentially the same thing as {djine}, but closedness is necessary.

column2: $v_4$=$g_2$=$c_1$ is a compact disc/optical disc storing $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event) in file(s) $v_1$.
$x_1$ is a sphincter (circular-annulic muscle)/muscular ring controlling $x_2$ [approximately: in orifice $x_2$] of/belonging to body $x_3$
column3: Sphincters usually must be relaxed in order to allow passage of substance, normally maintaining constriction. But this quality is not necessary for this definition (although it is hard to imagine a reverse scenario).

column2: $v_4$ is a gramophone record of $v_2$.
$x_1$ is a compass for drawing circles $x_2$.

$x_1$=$p_2$=$c_1$ (subject/concept) is conceivable under conditions $c_2$.
$cf_1$ is science fiction about possible universe $cu_1$=$m_1$ by author $cf_3$.
$k_1$ gambles/plays the lottery $k_2$.
$f_1$ is shuffled/randomly distributed/cut among $f_2$ with shares/portions $f_3$.
$g_1$ shuffles/randomly distributes/cuts $x_2$=$f_1$ among $x_3$=$f_2$ with shares/portions $x_4$=$f_3$.
$p_1$ bumps into/randomly encounters $p_2$ at/in location $p_3$.
$r_1$ is an unpredictable/irregular affix for word/concept $r_2$, with form/properties $r_3$, in language $r_4$.
column3: In Lojban, cunrafsi are {rafsi} (bound combining forms) that derive unpredictably from {gismu} (root predicate-words). They are morphemes of the forms CCV, CVC, CVV, and CV'V (where C is a consonant, V is a vowel, and ' is the special sound /h/). Rafsi of these forms must be memorized alongside their source gismu, since they are assigned arbitrarily (within some constraints). By contrast, rafsi of the forms CCVC and CVCC are always predictable, and match up one-for-one with gismu; these may be called {jvarafsi} ('rule-rafsi'). Note also: cunrafsi are not 'irregular' in the sense of being assigned informally in a non-standard manner; they are a part of standard, official Lojban.

column2: $n_1$=$c_1$ (li) is a random number (noun), random under conditions $c_2$, with probability distribution $c_3$.
$l_1$ makes a round trip via route $l_2$ using means/vehicle $l_3$.
$d_1$=$c_1$ is a looped ribbon/tape/strip/band/stripe [both ends are connected] and is of material $d_2$=$c_2$.
$p_1$=$c_1$ is a circularly ordered sequence by rule $p_2$ on unordered set $p_3$.
$c_1$=$f_1$ is an eel of species/breed $c_2$=$f_2$.
$x_1$=$k_1$ is a spokesperson of/speaks on behalf of $x_2$=$k_2$=$c_1$, saying $x_3$=$c_2$ to $x_4$=$c_3$ via expressive medium $x_5$=$c_4$.
$x_1$ edits/revises/adapts text $x_2$ by $x_3$ for audience $x_4$ in medium $x_5$.
$z_3$ is a condition for free expressive activity $z_2$ by agent $z_1$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ is topless; $x_1$'s chest is naked.
$b_1$ is a rib of body $b_3$=$c_2$.

$t_1$ is the upper back [body-part] of $c_2$.

$k_{1}$ (store/company/organization/entrance-way etc) is open/ajar/not shut permitting access to organized activity $k_2$=$c_1$ by $k_{3}$.
$s_1$=$j_1$=$c_1$ is bacteriology of bacteria $s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
column3: Bacteriology is the study of bacteria. Because of the similarity of thinking and working with microorganisms other than bacteria, there has been a tendency for the field of bacteriology to extend as microbiology (={jumske}). Bacteriology can be classified as a distinct science.

column2: $x_1$ is a just intonation with prime limit $x_2$ and odd limit $x_3$
column3: With only x1 specified, refers to generic just intonation, understood as "a tuning system where all intervals are expressed by rational numbers as ratios between frequencies". To refer to what is often named simply "just intonation" but instead means 5-limit just intonation, use "cuvyto'aci'e li mu". See also: {dunto'aci'e}.

column2: $x1$=$t1$ is a dilemma between $x2$=$t2$=$c3$

$t_1$ is a fighting technique / martial art used under conditions $t_3$ by $d_1$.
column3: t2 subsumed.  d2 and d3 not usually relevant to technique.  Made from {damba} + {tadji}.

column2: $x_1$ is a hanger for hanging $x_2$
column3: Refers to "hangers" for clothes or any other object, whether mobile (e.g. wire coat hanger) or affixed to a structure cf. {dandu}, {genxu}.

column2: $j_1$=$d_1$ is a pendant decorating  $j_2$ and hanging from $d_2$.
$x_1$ is Urechis
$x_1$ is a member of Hydrozoa/hydrozoan of subtaxa $x_2$
tagged sumti: can be used for embedded: it-1 said, "...", with editorial unquote and insert.
$j_1$=$c_1$ is an (eu)bacterium of species/defining property $j_2$.
column3: Bacteria are a large domain of single-celled, prokaryote (={pruslemijyji'e}) microorganisms. See also {jurme}, {tceprujurme}.

column2: $p_2$=$c_1$ filters $p_1$=$c_2$ to destination side $p_3$ from origin side $p_4$.

column3: dertu2, dertu3 and saske2 subsumed. Soil science studies the soil that occupies the pedosphere, one of Earth's spheres. This is not the same as geology (the lujvo for this should mean planetary+composition+science). The two main branches of soil science are pedology (={terderske}; the study of soil in its natural setting) and edaphology (the study of soil in relation to soil-dependent uses). See also {tedyske}, {rokske} and {kunske}.

column3: {detri} zei {krefu}. $krefu_2$ corresponds to the date of the first event, but the place is omitted for simplicity. $x_4$ may indicate the system of recurrence: a day of the week/month; a day/month of the year (anniversary); a year of the century etc. ex.) li renopavo pi'e pano pi'e re detke'u lo nu la gandis noi banli cu jbena kei li pavomu lo pa nanca be fi la gregoris (October 2 of 2014 is Mahatma Gandhi's 145th birthday counted by year of Gregorian calendar.)

$n_1$=$d_1$ is a calendar year according to calendar/standard $n_3$=$d_4$
$x_1$=$k_1$ is a charge card with accumulated debt $x_2$=$dej_1$ to creditor $x_3$=$dej_3$, with due date $x_4$=$det_1$
column3: Charge cards has due payment dates; for credit cards with credit limits see {jitseldejykarda}. Cf. {lejykarda}, {baxydinkarda}, {vamveile'ikarda}, {maksriveikarda}, {lejykardymi'i}, {banxa}, {pleji}, {jdini}.

column2: $x_1$ is a calendar day/24-hour period from 0 to 0 o'clock
$x_1$ is a leap day of year $x_2$ at location $x_3$ in calendary system $x_3$.
column3: This is a day which is included or removed from a 'normal' (yearly) progression of the calendar in order to correct the aligment between the reported date and the passage of physical time (such as that which is evinced by the seasons). See also: {tcikydragausnidu}.

column2: $d_1$=$t_1$ [years, months, days, hours, minutes, seconds] is the date and time of event/state $d_2$=$t_2$ at location $d_3$=$t_4$ by date/time system $x_4$
column3: Created to give date and time simultaneously and to be in line with ISO standard from most general to most specific. "{pi'e}" can be used to separate units, or "{ny}, {my}, {dy}, {cy}, {my} {ebu}, {sy}" can be used to jump to a specific date/time unit. Milliseconds can be added after "{pi}". See: {datrytcika} {dei'i'u}

column2: $g_1$ schedules time $t_1$[hours, {minutes}, {seconds}] and date $d_1$[day,{week},{month},year] for event $t_2$=$d_2$ at location $d_3$.
column5: book;plan time and date for event;schedule

column2: $x_1$ is the excess money/change (that should be) returned for/after/with the purchase of $x_2$ by purchaser $x_3$ from vendor $x_4$.
column3: Beware sumti-raising. If the ownership of an item costs 9.50 dollars and $x_3$ buys it with an acceptable bill of value 10.00 dollars, then the change ($x_1$) is the monetary value of 0.50 dollars (regardless of which bills, coins, etc. carry that value), where 'dollar' can represent any monetary unit.

column2: $f_1$=$j_3$ offers/proffers $f_2$=$j_1$ bid to $f_3$=$j_4$ for item/service $j_2$ in bidding system $f_4$.
$x_1$ is cute to $x_2$ in aspect $x_3$

column2: Deng Xiaoping
column3: Chinese head of state from 1978 to 1989. Lived 1904-1997.

column2: letteral: Lojban "." character.

column5: glottal plosive;glottal plosive sound;glottal stop;glottal stop sound;glottal-stop sound

column2: $x_1$ is a demon of type/mythology/religion $x_2$
$x_1$ has experienced $x_2$ (timestamp-style expression of dimensionful measure of time) units of time of existence/life according to standard $x_3$
column3: This word is broader/more general and more versatile/flexible than {nancaji}. $x_2$ may be any expression that is acceptable as the sumti submitted to the first terbri of {detri}; however, unlike {detri}$_1$, which can be interpreted as representing elapsed time from some culturally accepted reference start-time, this word measures running time from the start of the existence of $x_1$, according to standard $x_3$.

column2: $x_1$ pertains to the Gregorian calendar.
column3: If the context is clear, "detr-" can be omitted. Cf. {gregori zei nanca}, {gregori zei ctona'a}.

column2: Cancellation (instant-/usage-wise; temporary) of all defaults in immediately previous word
column3: Cancels/overrides/ignores/"kills" all defaults (default specifications) in the (terbri) structure of immediately previously uttered word so that implicit/omitted {zo'e} and{di’au} that may fill the terbri of that word are general in potential reference (modulo context) and do not necessarily agree with the default setting explicitly specified in the discourse-external/“official” definition of the word. The terbri are not filled by this word. Usage is only meaningful for a brivla with at least one terbri (regardless of being explicitly filled or otherwise). In a tanru or other complicated construct, only the most recent word undergoes this terbri default override (not every term in the construct). A selbri converted to a sumti by gadri has the x1 terbri filled for the purposes of this word, but the default setting of that terbri is so overridden all the same; likewise is the case for terbri accessed by {be} or {bei}; seltau in the main level of a sumti are filled by the gadri as well for the purposes of this word. The cancellation is only effective for the single occurrence/instant/usage of this word (the next use of the affected word will be implicitly accompanied by its terbri defaults, as defined elsewhere (by official definition or by other (permanent) modifications made to the word)). See also: {doi'a}, {de'au}, {zmico}.

column2: vocative: resuming conversation
vocative: \n{di'ai} - well-wish\n{di'ainai} - curse
column3: Used to express well-wishes/curses. See also {dimna}, {zandapma}, {dapma}, {ki'e}, {doi}

column2: pro-sumti and sumyzmico: discourse-interior default it (terbri-specific)
column3: Explicitly and emphatically references the specified default value of the relevant terbri as specified/designated by the discourse; thus, its value is context-dependent and subject to specification modifications. It does not necessarily reference the value defined "officially". ({zo'e}, implicit or explicit, may do so as well, but the use of this word implies some degree of a more deliberate choice to follow the default specification.) When a default of the terbri is not specified by the previous discourse (nor by the discourse-exterior "official" definition of the terbri if not specification modifications have been made previously), this word is equivalent to completely general and elliptical {zo'e}. See also: {di'oi}, {di'ei}.

column2: pro-sumti and sumyzmico: an elliptical/unspecified value which does not necessarily obey the default setting for the corresponding terbri that is explicitly specified in the definition of the word; has some value which makes bridi true
column3: Some brivla have default specifications for certain terbri; when any explicit sumti is omitted from filling these terbri (an implicit {zo'e} fills them instead), the meaning of that sumti is interpreted in accordance with the default specification; it is reasonable to suppose that an explicit {zo'e} used in order to fill such terbri will likewise obey the default specification in its interpretation.  Thus, there is no simple way to reference the "general" elliptical/unspecified value for these sumti, other than by using this word.  {zo'e} typically is interpreted as meaning any value of some general and unspecified set of potential sumti referents, modulated by context and the need to make the statement true; in the case of an explicit default setting of a terbri by the definition of a word, {di'ei} takes on this general and unspecified meaning, effectively ignoring the default (although it can take on the value of that default (doing so, simply, is just not necessary)); when no default is specified for the terbri in the definition, this word has the same meaning as {zo'e}. See also: {di'au}, {di'oi}, {zmico}.

column2: mathematical ternary operator: Dirichlet convolution $(a*b)(c)$
column3: $a,b$ are arithmetic functions, $c$ is an integer (the output is defined for at least strictly positive integers $c$). $(a*b)(c)$ is given by the sum (over all of the distinct ordered pairs $(n,m)$ belonging to the Cartesian product of the set of all strictly positive integers with itself, such that $n$ is not equal to $m$ and such that $nm = c$ (where adjacency represents typical multiplication of integers)) of $a(n)b(m)$ (where adjacency represents typical pointwise multiplication).

column2: tense interval modifier: irregularly/aperiodically; tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
$x_{1}$ is a cloud/mass of clouds of material $x_{2}$ in air mass $x_{3}$ at floor/base elevation $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fate/destiny of $x_{2}$; [doom, curse are mabla-forms]; $x_{2}$ is fated/predestined/doomed to $x_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ is a building/edifice for purpose $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a nail/tack [pointed driven/frictional fastener] of type/size $x_{2}$ (ka), made of material $x_{3}$.
column3: ($x_2$ also can be ni abstraction); See also {pijne}, {lasna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is dear/precious/darling to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is emotionally valued by $x_{2}$.
column3: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydirba} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {tcika}, {kargu}, {vamji}, {vajni}, {pleji}, {jadni}, {jemna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ radiates/emits $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a drop [small, cohesive shape] of material [liquid/vapor] $x_{2}$ in surrounding material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is low/down/downward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
column3: Also lower; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself.  See also {cnita}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {farna}, {loldi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity/expanse of water; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is aqueous/[aquatic].
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ full days in duration (default is 1 day) by standard $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is diurnal.
$x_{1}$ desires/wants/wishes $x_{2}$ (event/state) for purpose $x_{3}$.
column3: If desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in $x_2$ (or use lujvo = {po'edji}).  See also {taske}, {xagji}, {mukti}, {nitcu}, {nelci}, {pacna}, {prami}, {rigni}, {trina}, {xebni}, {xlura}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a ring/annulus/torus/circle [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, inside diam. $x_{3}$, outside diam. $x_{4}$.
column3: Also ellipse, oval (= {jincla}); (usage has been for near-circles, such as tight spirals, even if not closed loops).  Also band, belt, encircle (= {jinsru}).  See also {clupa}, {cukla}, {dasri}, {karli}, {sovda}, {sruri}, {konju}.

column2: {diklo} modal, 1st place                            in the location of ...
pro-sumti: the last utterance.
$x_1$ belongs to conjugacy class $x_2$ in structure $x_3$ under conditions $x_4$

$x_1$ is a non-binary/intersex (probably also can include: asexual, nongendered, indeterminately gendered) individual of species $x_2$ evidencing non-binary gender trait(s) $x_3$ (ka); $x_1$ is characterized by not following or fitting into some gender-binary.
$x_1$ is a 'dinosaur' [very general: any ancient quasi-reptilian vertebrate or, possibly but probably not, modern bird] of type $x_2$ living in era $x_3$.
column3: A gismu version of "{dinsauru}"; contrast with "{rexsa}" (in particular, this word probably would not but could refer to modern birds whereas "{rexsa}" can always do so without any connotation to the contrary; meanwhile, "{rexsa}" cannot refer to pterosaurs, ichthyosaurs, vel sim. but this word can). The use of this word is not strictly only relevant to members of clade Dinosauria, although it does include them (and, specifically, modern birds, although it connotes ancientness and extinction unless it is part of an explicitly contrary or general context); its referent might also/alternatively include pterosaurs, icthyosaurs, plesiosaurs, mosasaurs, dimetrodons, avemetatarsaliads, and perhaps even other ancient synapsids (in other words, any prehistoric quasi-reptilian vertebrate). As such, it is a qualitative word that bears no particular or strong attention or respect to genealogy, cladistics, taxology/taxonomy, or scientific/academic classification of these animals. Basically, any prehistoric animal the name of which ends in "-saur" can be so-described, as well as others. It probably should not reference more modern-like mammals proper. Proposed short rafsi: -dis-. See also: "{rexsa}", "{ketslau}", "{ikfiio}", "{disrmuzo}", "{plesiio}".

column2: $x_1$ is a non-binary/intersexed (probably also can include: asexual, nongendered, indeterminately gendered, gender-fluid, transgendered, two-spirited, alternatively gendered, or affirmatively non-binarily gendered or nongendered/graygendered) individual of species $x_2$ evidencing non-binary gender trait(s) $x_3$ (ka); $x_1$ is characterized by not following or fitting into some gender-binary.
column3: Co-equal to "{fetsi}" and "{nakni}". Proposed short rafsi: -dit-. See also "{fetsi}", "{nakni}", "{nunmu}".

column2: $x_1$ is the time-duration/interval/period/[elapsed time] of event $x_2$.

column3: The basic feature of live matter. x2 is the full set of cells born due to the division of $x_1$. See {fukpi}

column2: $x_1$ wants to do $x_2$ (property of $x_1$)
column3: Based off of {djica} and {ka}.  See also {djica}

column2: $x_1$ (number) is fully divisible by $x_2$ (number) // "$x_1$/$x_2$" is an integer // $x_2$ is a factor of $x_1$
$x_1$ is a prime number (a natural number greater than 1 that has no positive divisors other than 1 and itself)

column3: The mark can be natural or painted/tatooed/burnt in/etc.

column2: $x_1$ swears / takes an oath, promising/asserting $x_2$ (abstraction), invoking fate $x_3$ (abstraction)
column3: $x_2$ could be a nu-event or ka-action that $x_1$ intends to happen or perform, or a du'u-proposition that $x_1$ swears the truth of. $x_3$ is a fate (typically bad) that $x_1$ invokes on themself should they break the oath. {tu'a} can be used to raise $x_3$, to swear by a treasured possession (implied fate being loss of that possession), or a deity (implied fate being the wrath of said deity). See {dimna}, {maldimna}, {nupre}, {cevni}, {dapma}

column2: $r_1$ is rich (in money).

column3: In the termset that starts from $x_2$ each attribute is followed by its value, both are expressed as one sumti each. Each attribute is expressed using quotation or {le}-sumti. Value is one of: number ({li}-sumti), boolean value ({le} {jetnu} for "true"), string ({lu}-sumti, {zo}-sumti etc.), another object (internal heirarchy can be expressed using termsets). 'djeisone le broda li 5 le brode lo jetnu le mlatu nu'i lo ka ckaji le'i tuple be ce'u cu se kazmi kei li 4 nu'u' renders the following JSON: {"broda":5,"brode":true,"mlatu":{"ckaji le ka le'i tuple be ce'u cu se kazmi":4}}. See also {veirdjeisano}.

column2: pro-sumti & sumyzmico: discourse-exterior default it
column3: Explicitly and emphatically references the specified default value of the relevant terbri as given by "official" definitions (exterior to the discourse); this value ignores and is independent of any modifications made to the relevant default specification during the discourse. (zo'e, implicit or explicit, may do so as well, but the use of this word implies some degree of a more deliberate choice to follow the discourse-exterior default specification.) When a default is not specified by the definition of a word, this word is equivalent to completely general and elliptical {zo'e}. See also: {di'au}, {di'ei}, {zmico}.

$f_1 = r_1 = x_1$ (event; perhaps: spacetime coordinates) is an equinox for season $x_2$ at location/of or for celestial body/object $d_3 = x_3$ with respect to orbit/sun $x_4$.
column3: $x_2$ is inserted in order to maintain parallel structure to that of "{dornilteikezraifau}" (although note that this one is a season and that one can be a property abstraction; see the notes for that word) and cannot be derived from the relevant {veljvo}. Use of/reference to a season via seltau is, of course, also acceptable. Use "{critoinsa}" etc. for some amount of neutrality and objectivity concerning location and any biases which may be at play therefor. See also: "{ctenilteikeznulfau}".

column2: $f_1 = r_1 = x_1$ (event; perhaps: spacetime coordinates) is a solstice of extreme $r_3 = x_2$ ("ka" construct or season; default: "ka zmadu", which means "Summer solstice", unless context makes this interpretation untenable) at location/of or for celestial body/object $d_3 = x_3$ with respect to orbit/sun $x_4$.
column3: $x_3$ is akin to donri$_2$, but is more relevant to the concept of a solstice and the orbital mechanics which may be involved. Use "{dunraisa}" etc. for some amount of neutrality and objectivity concerning location and any biases which may be at play therefor. For a clever calque of English "soltstice", see: "{solsta}". See also: "{dornilteikeznulfau}", "{ctenilteikezraifau}".

column2: $x_1$ is the temporal direction of/toward solstice $x_2$ (event or spacetime coordinates or season (usually specify year); default: Summer solstice) from origin/in reference frame $x_3$ at location/for body $x_4$ and with respect to orbit/sun $x_5$.
column3: This is a radial direction ('inward' relative to $x_2$ and 'outward' relative to the solstice which is opposite to $x_2$), but in a temporal sense. Given that, for a fixed body and orbit, seasons are usually(?) cyclic, this word will usually reference the temporal direction which points toward the referenced solstice of the specified type which is nearest to $x_3$, unless the general pattern of behavior is being referenced or there is ambiguity/nondefinition (such as at the very moment of precisely the opposite solstice) or multiple $x_3$s are specified such that they do not share a unique nearest solstice of the specified type or it does not matter or is abstract/general. Use-case example: You are taking a trip to Iceland but want to be somewhat warm. Your friend suggests going in November. You can reply that you want to visit at a time which is more Summer-solsticeward via this word (relying/capitalizing on the default value for $x_2$). See also: "{dornilteikezraifau}".

pro-sumti whose referent's identity may be chosen by the listener
column3: Short for "lo poi'i do zifre lo ka jdice lo du'u ma kau me ke'a"; e.g. "ko ciksi bau do'au" (explain in any language you like!), "mi ba klama fo do'au" (I'll go, and you're free to choose what route I'll go by), "do'au sivni do" (you're free to keep whatever you want private to yourself). The chosen identity may be plural; the last example shows this is useful. See {nau'o}. Also kind of like {ma}, but instead of "please fill this hole with a truthful thing for my sake (and tell me it)", it's "please fill this hole with a preferred thing for your sake (and act on it)".

column2: gafyzmico: Reset all default specification of the immediately previous word to their respective discourse-external/official definition specifications for this instance/usage only.
column3: Resets all defaults (default specifications) in the (terbri) structure of immediately previously uttered word so that implicit/omitted {zo'e} and {di'au} that may fill the terbri of that word are predefined/specific in reference and do indeed necessarily agree with the default setting explicitly specified in the discourse-exterior/”official” definition of the word. The terbri are not filled by this word. Usage is only meaningful for a brivla with at least one terbri (regardless of being explicitly filled or otherwise). In a tanru or other complicated construct, only the most recent word undergoes this terbri default restoration (not every term in the construct). A selbri converted to a sumti by gadri has the x1 terbri filled for the purposes of this word, but the default setting of that terbri is so restored all the same; likewise is the case for terbri accessed by {be} or {bei}; seltau in the main level of a sumti are filled by the gadri as well for the purposes of this word. The restoration is only effective for the single occurrence/instant/usage of this word (the next use of the affected word will be implicitly accompanied by its terbri defaults, as defined elsewhere (by official definition or by other (permanent) modifications made to the word)). See also: {dau'a}, {de'oi}, {zmico}
column5: default reset (across all associated terbri);default restoration (across all associated terbri)
